title: Special Provisions for States in the Indian Constitution

information.title: Purpose
information.description: Special provisions are included in the Constitution to address the unique needs, protect the interests, and preserve the cultural identity of certain states and regions in India.

information.title: Article 370
information.description: Article 370 provided special status to Jammu and Kashmir, giving it significant autonomy. However, in August 2019, this article was effectively abrogated by a presidential order.

information.title: Article 371
information.description: Articles 371 to 371J contain special provisions for several states including Maharashtra, Gujarat, Nagaland, Assam, Manipur, Andhra Pradesh, Sikkim, Mizoram, Arunachal Pradesh, Goa, and Karnataka.

information.title: Sixth Schedule
information.description: The Sixth Schedule of the Constitution provides for the administration of tribal areas in Assam, Meghalaya, Tripura, and Mizoram through Autonomous District Councils.

information.title: Fifth Schedule
information.description: The Fifth Schedule provides for the administration and control of Scheduled Areas and Scheduled Tribes in states other than Assam, Meghalaya, Tripura, and Mizoram.

information.title: Special Category States
information.description: Some states are designated as Special Category States, which receive preferential treatment in terms of central assistance and tax breaks. This category includes most Northeastern states and some others.

quizQuestions.question: What is the purpose of special provisions for states in the Indian Constitution?
options: To address unique needs and preserve cultural identity of certain states
To give more power to the central government
To reduce the autonomy of all states
quizQuestions.correctAnswer: To address unique needs and preserve cultural identity of certain states

quizQuestions.question: Which article previously provided special status to Jammu and Kashmir?
Which schedule of the Constitution provides for the administration of tribal areas in certain Northeastern states?
What does the Fifth Schedule of the Constitution deal with?
options: Administration of Scheduled Areas and Scheduled Tribes in certain states
Division of powers between Centre and States
quizQuestions.correctAnswer: Administration of Scheduled Areas and Scheduled Tribes in certain states

quizQuestions.question: What benefit do Special Category States receive?
options: Preferential treatment in central assistance and tax breaks
quizQuestions.correctAnswer: Preferential treatment in central assistance and tax breaks

quizQuestions.question: Article 370, providing special status to Jammu and Kashmir, is still fully operational.
The Sixth Schedule applies to all states in India.
Special provisions for states are included in Articles 371 to 371J of the Constitution.
The Fifth Schedule and Sixth Schedule deal with the same states.
Most Northeastern states are designated as Special Category States.
